message.content:
I need to identify the cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the period from the financial statement.

Looking at the cash flow statement, I can see that there is a specific line item labeled "Beginning Balance" under the "Cash and Cash Equivalents" section:

| Account | Amount | Date |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Cash and Cash Equivalents |  | 2024-01-30 |
| Beginning Balance  | 8000000.00 | 2024-01-30 |
| Ending Balance  | 3276562.05 | 2024-01-30 |
| Net Increase  | -4723437.95 | 2024-01-30 |

This clearly shows that the beginning balance of cash and cash equivalents was 8,000,000.00.

I can also verify this by looking at the balance sheet, where the sum of "Cash on Hand" and "Bank Deposits" at the initial date (2023-12-31) equals:
3,000,000.00 + 5,000,000.00 = 8,000,000.00

Both sources confirm that the cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the period was 8,000,000.00.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '8000000.00'} }
```
